event.title: used to be two secondary schools but they have now

data.event: There used to be two secondary schools but they have now amalgamated to produce Pobalscoil Chorca Dhuibhne.

event.title: were being exported through Dingle than Limerick, and in 1257

data.event: By the thirteenth century more goods were being exported through Dingle than Limerick, and in 1257 an ordinance of Henry III imposed customs on the port's exports.
Maurice FitzGerald, 1st Earl of Desmond, who held palatine powers in the area, imposed a tax on this activity around 1329.
